result.execSummary:
The defendant Mark A Demeuse was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-Business Setting >$5000-$10,000 [Modifiers: Penalty - Theft >$5000-$10,000], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Door County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes: Court has set a Probation Review Hearing for 6/13/16 at 3:00 PM.

miscConds.notes: To pay restitution plus any statutorily authorized surcharges. $500 cash bond forwarded to Bistro 42 to apply toward restitution owing.
No contact with the victim, Bistro 42.

Complete any counseling, evaluations, programs and assessments, including AODA assessment, as appropriate resulting from the Department's COMPAS assessment. Defendant can petition for early termination of probation after 18 months upon successful completion of all conditions of probation and with recommendation from Dept. of Corrections.

$100 fine plus costs.   If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt. To pay supervision fees as ordered by the Dept. of Corrections.
Maintain full-time employment but not to have unfedered access to employers money.

timeConds.notes: One month stayed for each $1,000 paid toward restitution. Huber release is granted. To commence forthwith.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

records.descr: Notice of court ordered financial obligations

records.addlTxt: New discharge date is 6/08/20.
and stipulation to waive appearance and hearing.

Defendant Mark A Demeuse in court.  Nicholas Grode appeared for the State of Wisconsin. DOC Agent Ann Nehring appears by phone. Court reviews events in file, reviews sentence previously imposed. Court questions agent on payments being made by defendant. Agent Nehring indicates defendant pays what he can, he's paid about $250 toward restitution so far.  Defendant was hoping to make a payment toward restitution once he received his tax return, hasn't receive refund yet. Agent Nehring will likely be extending defendants probation if restitution is not paid.  Court not letting defendant off probation until restitution/finanical obligations, are paid. Court will not set another PRH, agent can request hearing if she feels one is needed. Court would like to see significant restitution payments in the near future.

Restitution Summary

Defendant Mark A Demeuse in court with attorney Gregory A. Gerbers.  Defendant Mark A Demeuse in custody.  Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court reviews events in file. State/Defense ready to proceed to sentencing without the benefit of a PSI. Defendant waives right to PSI.  State/Defense make joint sentencing recommendation.  Court makes statement, imposes sentence. Bond is no longer in effect.
or Transport defendant from Brown County Jail to court on 6/08/15.

Attorney Gregory A. Gerbers appears by phone.  Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court reviews events in file. Atty Gerbers apologizes to the court, indicates he received an answer from Drug Court in Brown County late last week that defendant was not going to be accepted into their program. Atty Gerbers indicates it was too late to get a transport order to bring defendant back for sentencing, asks court to reschedule matter. State has no objection. Court reschedules.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for June 8, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Mark A Demeuse in court with attorney Gregory A. Gerbers.  Defendant Mark A Demeuse in custody.  Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court reviews events in file. Atty Gerbers indicates they are awaiting a decision from Brown County whether defendant be accepting into drug court. Atty Gerbers requests a 30 day adjournment. State indicates victim won't be happy but can't force him to go to sentencing today. Bond remains in effect.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for June 1, 2015 at 02:30 pm.
or Transport defendant for court on 4/27/15 at 9:30 am.

records.descr: Notice and acknowledge of def voting ineligibility

records.addlTxt: for DNA Sample

Defendant Mark A Demeuse in court with attorney Gregory A. Gerbers.  Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Minute sheet. State gives plea agreement.  Court questions defendant on change of plea.  Rights/elements/max. penalties reviewed with defendant.  Defendant enters no contest plea to Ct. 1.  Defense stipulates to factual basis to accept plea.  Court finds plea made freely, knowingly and voluntarily, accepts plea, and finds guilty of Ct. 1. Court dismisses Ct. 2 but reads in for sentencing.  Court reviews collateral consequences of felony conviction, possible penalties. Court orders Defendant to submit DNA sample. Bond remains in effect.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for April 27, 2015 at 09:30 am.

Defendant Mark A Demeuse in court with attorney Gregory A. Gerbers.  Raymond Pelrine appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court reviews events in file. Atty Gerbers indicates defendant will be receiving an inheritance in 60-90 days which will pay a majority of the restitution. Atty Gerbers requests a status in 60 days to see where matter is at. State would like to see a plea today, has no objection to setting off sentencing for 60 days. Court grants 30 day continuance, indicates we need to keep this matter moving. Bond remains in effect.  Status conference scheduled for February 23, 2015 at 10:30 am.

Defendant Mark A Demeuse in court with attorney Gregory A. Gerbers.  Raymond Pelrine appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court reviews events in file. Atty Gerbers feels matter is close to resolving, asks court to set possible plea for 1/30/15. State has no objection. Bond remains in effect.  Status conference scheduled for January 30, 2015 at 10:00 am.

Attorney Gregory A. Gerbers in court.  Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court calls case at 9:18 AM, reviews events in file. Atty Gerbers has no information to provide the court as to why defendant is not in court, requests time to locate defendant.  State requests bench warrant. Court orders bench warrant but stays signing it until noon on Wednesday, 12/10/14 to give Atty Gerbers time to locate defendant. Court advises mail sent to defendant was returned undeliverable. Atty Gerbers will look into matter and let court know if he gets in contact defendant.
Defense waives reading of Information and enters not guilty plea.  Bond remains as is.
